TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
Disclaimer: Some questions may not be answerable, for various reasons.

The word of the thread is: Automagically.

THIS IS NOT A CHAT THREAD.

Mods-

How often are you called upon to examine the post of a Curious George, only to have it be a spambot?

Can you show us an example of what their messages look like?

Are the majority of the users on the forum humans? About how many unique users are active on the forum per month?

What do you do with a spambot?

About how many people join the forums per day?

Everyone else-

Have you ever wondered about this, or is it just me?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-09-20T02:36:01Z" title="09/20/2015 02:36  AM" data-short="8 yr">September 20, 2015</time> by Dman979**

1) Most unfortunate typo ever

2) I don't really think spambots are too big of a problem on here. Either the mods handle them with such efficiency that I've never noticed one, or they just plain dont exist here.

3) Not just you, I've wondered about it briefly in the past.
why are there SO MANY??????///

The post moderation system (The thing that means that your first 5 posts need to be approved) helps us spot most of them. They post mostly just inane words, with links to what they are advertising. Can't see any spam in the modqueue, so no examples. Some have semi relevant things to say, often with a link at the end. I would say most users on the forum are human, even us mods. Don't know about unique users on the forum per month.

Now this is where it gets fun. First, allow me to describe it in pokemon battle format:

A wild spambot appears!

Go, Modkip!

Spambot uses spam!

It isn't very effective...

Modkip uses Spam-O-Matic!

It's super effective!

Spambot is banished from the forum!

Modkip gets satisfaction for winning!

\*ahem\*

"But what is the Spam-O-Matic?" I hear you ask! We can tick posts, and can perform a list of actions to said posts. Ranging from Delete Post, to Move Post, and many in between. Spam-O-Matic is one of these, and is my personal favourite. We tick the post, proceed with the action, and it then removes the spambot from the forum. Aspiring mods can look forward to their first squishing of a bot.

Hope this helps.

> 
> How often are you called upon to examine the post of a Curious George, only to have it be a spambot?

Can't speak for the other mods, but I get at least a half dozen a week, sometimes substantially more. 

> 
> Can you show us an example of what their messages look like?

Not a specific one, but most of them are your typical spam email-like content. Some are in foreign languages in the English sections, some are really sketchy looking (can't tell specifics without violating the posting guidelines), those ones are easy to catch.

The more troubling ones are clever, they copy text from an existing post and repost it with a link added. This is easy to miss as the posts seem coherent and on-topic.

> 
> Are the majority of the users on the forum humans?

AFAIK all our users are human. Except Rainbowtrout, he's a mudkip. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> About how many unique users are active on the forum per month?

I don't see that info, sorry. Maybe Kasper or one of the admins can comment.

> 
> What do you do with a spambot?

As Rainbowtrout said, we have a "Spam-O-Matic" tool, which automagically removes the user and deletes all threads, posts and blog entries made by them.

> 
> About how many people join the forums per day?

When I started moderating back in January it was only a couple of users a day. Since 1.0 was released we've seen a real surge in new users, not unusual to see twenty or more per day.

> 
> AFAIK all our users are human. Except Rainbowtrout, he's a mudkip. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

\*cough\*

I remember when I helped catch some spambot that had taken one of Wallygator's posts. I'm not a mod but it was pretty darn satisfying. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Huh, wow! You guys do a great job. Remind me not to mess with the Spam-o-matic.

So, when I go on to the member list, I see all sorts of weird names with crazy numbers-letter combinations. They normally have less than 3 posts. Are they spambots that haven't posted anything yet, or just really really inactive users?'

Modkip, when I joined, the CG limit was 3. Has it changed to reflect the new users?

Red Iron Crown, I like that word which you used; "Automagically." I can't figure out if it's a typo or a real thing.

> 
> Huh, wow! You guys do a great job. Remind me not to mess with the Spam-o-matic.

it a magnetic emotive field micro variation you throw in the key when your typing something on your keyboard or touchpad that flow trough the internet ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) (\*scarry mode on/off\*)

hum just kidding "automagically" it's what it is ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) magic so yup don't mess with the spam o matic it's everywhere ; ) basicaly spam o atic just use the force ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> So, when I go on to the member list, I see all sorts of weird names with crazy numbers-letter combinations. They normally have less than 3 posts. Are they spambots that haven't posted anything yet, or just really really inactive users?'
> Modkip, when I joined, the CG limit was 3. Has it changed to reflect the new users?

1) Could be either, really. It's impossible to say without looking at what they've posted.
2) The CG limit was originally 5. It was temporarily changed to 3 just to alleviate possible headache for users who had to make a new account on the forums following the forum crash and subsequent data loss that happened a while back, but it was returned to its original value after that. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Modkip, when I joined, the CG limit was 3. Has it changed to reflect the new users?

I think it was increased to provide additional defence against spammers, but I'm not sure.

No, it's kind of run down, with a bunch of mismatched desks and a very old coffee machine.

On the average day, how many thread locks/post deletions do you guys have to do?

Mathematically there must be an average, but there is no typical day. Sometimes you guys are grumpy, and we have a lot of fires to put out in the span of a few hours. Other times, we can go days without needing to intervene. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Other times, we can go days without needing to intervene. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I imagine those days are your favorite.

Also, I'm surprised no one has asked this yet. How was your day, all of you? I don't see why all these questions have to be inquiring. Why not just a simple one?

I do hope it was lovely for each of you. It is well deserved.

So, I have a couple of questions:

1. When a post is reported, is it looked at right away, or do you wait for posts to be reported multiple times before you look at it?
2. How many reports do you get a day?
3. Of those, how many do not require action and/or are people just reporting posts to be rude?

Thanks for your time. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
